I get a NullPointerException when I try to create (New -> Project) a 
new project using a standard C Make project. It seems that the window
never appears correctly.

java.version=1.4.2_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=fr_FR
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 juil. 20, 2004 10:59:35.257
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 juil. 20, 2004 10:59:35.257
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.cdt.make.ui.dialogs.SettingsBlock.createBuildCmdControls
(SettingsBlock.java:146)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.make.ui.dialogs.SettingsBlock.createControl
(SettingsBlock.java:246)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.ui.dialogs.TabFolderOptionBlock.addTab
(TabFolderOptionBlock.java:119)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.make.internal.ui.MakeProjectOptionBlock.addTabs
(MakeProjectOptionBlock.java:26)


I am using eclipse 3.0, if you wish i can send the full configuration 
file.

Created an attachment (id=13447)
Configuration information

This is the configuration information related to this bug report.

By reinstalling everything from scratch, the problem seems to have completely 
disappeared.
